website_summaries.verdict: The highest quality earbuds from the trusted Samsung brand.
pros: Great noise cancellation and sound quality for music and calls
Perfect for those with an active lifestyle, providing comfort, stability, and superior sound quality
cons: Possible discomfort depending on listener's ear size

website_summaries.verdict: Amazing quality ear buds at an affordable price.
pros: Great noise cancellation, call quality and battery life
Designed for movement and especially for those on the go

customer_reviews.title: Good Upgrade from Original Buds
customer_reviews.text: Original buds were good. These are great! Much improved call quality. Music sounds better too with an additional speaker (woofer and tweeter). All day and then some battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was very disappointing. I bought them based on consumer reports saying good sound, but it didn't deliver. I have some great workout music that I love with strong bass, but it was tinny and weak on these Samsung buds plus. I then tried Beats and Bose, and only the Bose delivered the full bass and range I was looking for, with great ambient noise islation as well.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than my Airpods Pros
customer_reviews.text: These fit better (meaning they are way more comfortable, and they will not slip out like my airpod pros do). The music, podcasts and YouTube videos all sound rich and brilliant (use the Dynamic setting in the app). Passthrough sound works a million times better, which is extremely useful since earbuds dampen sound around you naturally... Which is why i don't miss the active noise cancelling at all. Here's the major thing, I can go the entire work day off one charge! I grew tired of the 4 hour limit before having to charge my pros... So now they can sit the hell down somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: VINTAGE

customer_reviews.title: Hoodwinked
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the ambient noise. I've only ever used one ear bud. Thought these would be a great way to enjoy using both. However that feature is only available when using a app that requires access to everything on your phone. This is unacceptable. It should be available stand alone. A simple pattern a pushes wouldn't have been hard to add. Guess the opportunity to make more profit was to hard for them to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Core

customer_reviews.title: Don't even waste your time/money
customer_reviews.text: The right headphone never connected. I've done multiple things (as recommended) to fix the issue and nothing worked. I reset my phone, deleted the Galaxy Wearable app and re downloaded it, disconnected and connected the headphones countless times. Let the batteries drain and try to recharge them hoping it would work. NOTHING. I tried to contact the seller and no reply. I contacted a Samsung representative they said "go to a repair center" FOR A BRAND NEW SET OF HEADPHONES FRESH OUT OF THE BOX? I shouldn't have to get something repaired that's brand new. Really disappointing that I paid $140 for one working headphone. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right earbud dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Right earbud does not connect/pair. Have to exchange and the new pair will take a month to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M.

customer_reviews.title: Hook, line and sinker.
customer_reviews.text: Does not support simultaneous multi-point connectivity as once stated in the features, on the product pages here and on samsungs site. Those descriptions have since been removed. That is why I upgraded to these. I feel like I was baited into the purchase, thank you amazon for allowing me to process my return.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: horrible bass
customer_reviews.text: I am sending these back. The bass was horrible and so was the volume. My four year old Jaybird X2's sound 100 times better. Maybe I got a defective pair since mostly all other reviews say the sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: J.K.

customer_reviews.title: Falls out of my ear as soon as I move my Mouth!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Samsung products since 2011 when I switched over from a IPhone and I've been a happy customer until now! I've tried every combination of the tips they provided and regardless of which one I use or if I get a good seal or not in my ear as soon as start talking or smiling the earbuds fall out! 2 days after I got them one of them fell out on my run and almost went down the sewer! I'm really disappointed with this product I hope I Can return them.
customer_reviews.author: Eamon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Buds! These are the shiznit!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these ear buds!!! They are fantastic. If you read a review from anyone saying they suck, I humbly submit they are incapable of reading directions and setting the buds up correctly. You need a seal on the ear by using the correct wing fin piece or no fin at all (like my ears required) and the correct ear piece. I cannot get over the ear candy I am enjoying. The bass is solid, and the battery life is impressive. Definitely better than the previous buds. I highly recommend them. Currently listening to Depeche Mode and the music coming out agrees with this statement!
customer_reviews.author: veritasuser

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I can not fully rate these. I bought these last week and received them on Friday after waiting 4 days. When I finally get them one of the ear buds was defective and didnt work. I called samsung and was told to mail them back in. Which I did on the same Friday via UPS. Samsung received the earbuds yesterday. I called to check the status of new earbuds and was told them would possibly arrive by next Tuesday. So I have to wait a week before I get new ones. I cancelled the order to get a refund and to be told that the exchange/refund office is out of the office and my refund would take alot longer. SMH!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right bud wont connect
customer_reviews.text: Right ear bud will not connect. Tried resetting it, uninstalling samsung wearables. one website said try updating the app to get the right bud to work but the update says it cant update UNTIL the right bud works. Very upset after 150$. I bought another pair from another brand for my wife and those work beautifully easily and without hassle. Just wish my right bud would connect as these look better in my opinion. but whats looks matter if it doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Albert

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Samsung Buds+ in April 2020 and they quit working in July 2020. I sent a message back to this seller and obviously I was out of the time-frame for a return. So they told me to deal with Samsung for the warranty. So I did. Samsung then told me my warranty is voided because the set I received was an international model, NOT THE AMERICAN MODEL!!!!! I was so pissed. Then they wanted $108 to repair these headphones. If your American, don't even buy these because your going to get screwed like I did! The only way to make this right is to let me exchange these for another pair or give me a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Olguin

customer_reviews.title: Total fraud, do not buy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy galaxy ear from Amazon just received ear budds 10 minutes ago, open box and nothing inside box. No charge cable, no ear budds. And Serial number outside box was peeled off.
customer_reviews.author: CkR

customer_reviews.title: Started to Hurt
customer_reviews.text: These were ok, at first these didn’t hurt like other earbuds did for me, such as Jabra 75t, or the AirPods Pro. But after a handful of days, they started to hurt and just starting to tear up the inside my ears. It’s tough to find ones that truly fit inside your ears as there are no two ears that are alike. So I will go back to the Sony’s XM3’s as they are held in place by the actual earbud tip, as oppose to the actual plastic housing as all the other earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Mouse9mm

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth is horrible, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth is absolutely horrible!!! Starts cutting out a few feet away and if you turn your head or body, or have object block line of site they do not work at all. Even if you just put you hand over the phone they do not work. I had $10 wireless head phones before this and the worked 150% better than these. If I can return I will be today. For the cost of these the Bluetooth should work flawlessly and at long ranges. They work as long as you phone is within three feet and has line of sight. I do not recommend to buy these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Necromonger

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, but the right one got quiet all of a sudden
customer_reviews.text: The right earbud volume suddenly got really low and I am unable to fix it. They sound great and work great other than that. I have had many other true wireless buds where the volume gets low after using for some time. Edit: Tried to submit a warranty claim to Samsung, but they won't accept my Amazon invoice as a valid proof of purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MadDucks

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service and Product Support
customer_reviews.text: There is an issue with my left ear bud. Something with a mic in the left one while in ambient mode. I've tried several times to contact customer service and have been lied to about tickets being opened for my issue. Very poor customer service with different people telling very different stories. I just want to get my issue fixed so that i can clearly hear people while on the phone as that is my main method of working during the current pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very very disappointed 😔
customer_reviews.text: Order first pair Feb 17th by the 29th I was ordering another pair got those on march 1st today is April 5 and same problem on new pair both volume go extremely low in one speaker. Dont believe YouTube videos about touchpad volume helps this it dont. Also if ear wax gets behind silver gill speaker sound like it's not even on only way to fix this is basically destroying the buds by taking the grill of (which u cant put back on) and cleaning black fiber thing behind the grill...dont waste ur money u been WARNED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: terrance

customer_reviews.title: The upgrade you need
customer_reviews.text: I had lost the right bud of my previous generation Galaxy Buds and knew I had to get the next one that came out. Had these since launch day and couldn't be more happy about owning them. I use these on a day to day basis and the battery life is incredibly mind blowing. I practically wear them with no problem. My most favorite feature about these are the ambient noise because I'm pretty sure I've already damage my ear drums. So these are able to enhance my hearing and makes me realize I love these. Definitely an upgrade so just get them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Velilla

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Had it for couple of months and took good care of them, but the right earbud became defective all of the sudden and I’m not the only one with the odd issue
customer_reviews.author: Obed Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: It's only been 3 days since I've had them but I absolutely love them so far! They're so easy to carry around and use everywhere. The ambient mode is super useful and great that you can turn it on and off easily buy holding the touchpad for 3 seconds. They sound awesome, great bass, and suuuuuper comfortable. They're so light you can barely tell they're in your ears and I've been wearing them for 4 hours straight as of writing this and they aren't uncomfortable even a little. No-brainer for $150. Get them, you'll love them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: The headphone equvilant of a Tesla that can't go above 5mph.
customer_reviews.text: This is SO DISAPPOINTING!!! I bought the red version of the Buds + and they are gorgeous, comfortable, and easy to use!....BUT absolutely awful sound quality. I tried every sound option they have on the app, then tried them with my iPhone instead of my S9 and it doesn't make a difference. They just sound bad. Even comparing them to the free wired earbuds that came with my Galaxy S9 is a joke. These sound the same as the $5 knockoff pair my wife picked up on clearance from walmart. Ugh, I'm so disappointed. I don't want to get those stupid Apple ones with the stick hanging down. I might try the Bose ones next.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've watched hours of YouTube reviews of earbuds to determine which ones were for me. I needed sound quality with a price under $200, decent battery life, and water resistant to a degree. Every video had positive results with the buds+. I am completely satisfied with this selection. Sound only lacks deep bass (as most earbuds do). Turning on the ambient mode offers hearing to your surroundings. You can make it a slight pick up of surrounding of noises to hearing your neighbor's conversation across the street. They're comfortable enough and don't protrude from your ears like other more expensive ones. Great earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: very nice for the price ios user but hurts my ear
customer_reviews.text: sound quality isn't that impressive compared to my AirPods 2 tbh i like the sound of the airpods better, don't expect to be blown away. some pros about the galaxy buds are, better battery life, call quality is nice, and a hundred dollars cheaper over the pros. I also own the pros and like the sound quality better on those and are more comfortable, also the pros transparency mode sound more clear over the galaxy buds plus ambient mode. the galaxy earbuds make my ears hurt. Overall, I'll recommend getting the pros if you are an ios user but if you are not looking to spend that kind of money go with these they are a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME clear phone conversations!
customer_reviews.text: I got a call from someone who mentioned that she had just gotten these. I asked her how they worked for phone calls, as I had never had luck with ANY brand. She said, clear as you please, what do you think? She was talking into them and it was perfect. I ordered some the same day, for my Galaxy 10, and so far nobody knows I'm using them or reports any problems hearing or understanding me. They also sound perfect on my side, and fit beautifully. LOVE THEM!!! WORTH THE MONEY. Oh, and music sounds great on them also 😁
customer_reviews.author: Linda Herner

customer_reviews.title: Fall out during exercise
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the Apple buds I lost. I wear them to exercise. Unlike the Apple buds, I cannot keep these Galaxy Buds Plus from falling out. I’ve changed the silicone inserts and followed the insertion directions I got from Samsung customer service. I switched brands because these were recommended by Consumer Reports. The sound may be a little better, but if they won’t stay in for me, I can’t use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Dunne

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Value; Made Even More Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Brief summary: The Galaxy Buds+ are a very decent set of truly wireless earbuds, and great successor to the original Galaxy Buds. They are lightweight, comfortable, have a long battery life, and the sound quality is more than sufficient enough for enjoying music on the go. They also cancel out a decent amount of noise despite the fact that there is no Active Noise Cancellation. There is also great synergy between devices, especially Samsung devices, if you own them. Whether you're on iOS or Android, these are a better choice compared to the other offers in this price point, and even beyond. (Yes, even AirPods).
customer_reviews.author: Donnerstag

customer_reviews.title: So far the best buds I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: So I tried several similar products borrowing from my friends to test and never found anything I really liked. I heard about the newest version of these being out and thought that given my past experience with the older versions this would be a good choice and so far these are by far the best buds I've ever used. Not exceptional quality like my Bose Noise Cancelling Wireless Bluetooth Headphones 700, which would be unfair since they are $400, but still a very good sound quality, very easy connection to all my devices and their app is reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan - WA

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy Buds + plus is the King
customer_reviews.text: I tried Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 and Aukey EP-N5. ALL I can say Samsung Galaxy Buds+ Plus is the best. It has truly 11 hours battery life, fit perfectly in my ear and won't drop out easy. Especially, it has clear call in noise environment like factory or restaurant. It is also good soundproof, I am not even use Ambient sound figure. Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 has cristal sound, I love it a lot. But the microphone is worse in noise environments. Your friend can't here you on other side easy. Aukey EP-N5 is good with microphone, better than Anker but below Samsung. The soundproof will kill your battery power.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin, TX

customer_reviews.title: Not angry, but what went wrong?
customer_reviews.text: They're great headphones and last a long time. However, just after two days (using them just a few times) my right headphone stopped making as much volume as the other and my enhanced hearing option was on, but the changing volume right to left was not. I'm a huge Samsung fan, but this was a disappointment that swayed me a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Anderson

customer_reviews.title: *Honest Review* These earbuds are a Mixed Bag with Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: PROS: *Great features if you have a Samsung device like I do (i paired these earbuds with my galaxy note 8) *you can view the battery life of the buds case and buds from your paired Samsung device *Amazing battery life CONS: *low-quality sound (very weak non-existent bass) *useless equalizer with lack-luster presets, bass boost is almost unnoticeable *doesn't pair with PC (it didn't for me at least) *Bluetooth signal strength is average at best I left my paired phone (galaxy note 8) in my bedroom and walked to my apartment kitchen; the earbuds immediately starts cutting out and glitching CONCLUSION: these are average buds that are NOT worth their $149 asking price
customer_reviews.author: Satinee

customer_reviews.title: Now have 1 bud ambient sound
customer_reviews.text: I might be a little bias. Im a Samsung guy, love my galaxy stuff. They are better than original buds. Not a big difference in sound. The sound is always good. The improvement is in the battery life, ambient is stronger and can be used wearing only 1 bud now. I have heard from people I talk to on the phone that the sound on there end is better. I think that's due to the extra mic on the buds+. So improvements basically extra mic for sound on your caller's end and ambient. As well as 1 bud ambient. Last, battery life on buds and case.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Left bud stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Update: as many others have experienced my left bud has stopped working. Obviously this is a known issue and I'm outside the return window. I would not recommend these at all. I don't believe I should have to give the app permission to my calendar just to be able to listen to music with these ear buds. If you try and deny any permission they ask for, the app will not work. It's disappointing as I like the sound produced but I am not comfortable with the required permissions. Samsung should give us a choice on permissions, but instead I have to choose to return them.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: buy warranty
customer_reviews.text: make sure to buy a warranty. i thought after buying two pairs of the old galaxy buds that all went bad on the right side that perhaps they had fixed the issue. not quite. this is my third pair of galaxy buds that has gone completely bad on the right side and doesnt play any sound any more. thankfully, i wised up and bought a warranty so i will let you guys know if my fourth pair is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Potential buyer

customer_reviews.title: 1 month use, left ear stopped working
customer_reviews.text: im pro samsung bet i'm really pissed. i had until today to return the earbuds but everything was fine. just when the deadline is past, the left ear stopped working. i tried reseting and all the other options. nothing works. and no, i didnt dropped them or put them in water. i dont even use them to exercise, just to watch series and listen to some music! i just lost 139$ i guess
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough, definitely a pass.
customer_reviews.text: Look pretty, Terrible sound quality, no noise cancelation, ambient voice passthrough is echoey and tinny (terrible), tech functions are excellent, you will experience physical ear damage due to poor anatomical design. They fit in/on your ear, but with great discomfort that you'll start to notice within 10 minutes. Alternative size parts do not help. They were so bad I didn't even take pictures. Got the Bose after much research. Go with the less techy Bose SoundSport wireless earbuds, you won't be disappointed... If you care about sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: N+B+O

customer_reviews.title: Issues started after 2 weeks of use...
customer_reviews.text: I loved them in the first 2 weeks!!!. After 2 weeks, they started losing connection to my phone, muffle sound and make me hear robots and people were not able to hear me well very frequently. The left battery started to drain much quicker than the right one and I need to charge them more frequently. The ambiant sound feature is super cool, but sometimes you hear the air passing by, specially after I upgraded their software. I was super happy with them the first 2 weeks, and I accepted the fact that they do not have noise cancelling feature, but the fact it is not allowing me to make quality calls is not okay :(
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fit well, and sound pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I don't think full wireless buds have reached their technological peak as of yet, but these are pretty close. My only issues are around sound quality. It may be unfair to compare these to over the ear phones, but that's all I've got. Everything sounds a little thin compared to my ote headphones. Bass isn't as deep, mid range isn't as solid, and high range is great. Highly recommend for usability, and ease of use. But if you only want the absolute best possible sound quality, wireless earbuds aren't for you
customer_reviews.author: Saint Tardamus

customer_reviews.title: Only one earbud works - and there was no charging cord!  Back they go
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually disappointed, because I have a Samsung phone. I got these hoping for magic - but only ONE earbud would connect. Crazy. I searched online and saw SO MANY POSTS of people complaining about the same thing - which is odd, since you don't hear about that with any other earbuds. From what I could tell from just the right earbud, the sound quality seems good, so I'm really disappointed. Secondary issue is that the charging cord wasn't in the box. I could live with that - but not only ONE earbud working. Back they go.
customer_reviews.author: HeathCliff

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 sets, 0 sets still work
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of these headphones. After less than 2 months of use both pairs are inoperable for the following reasons: Pair 1 - right headphone no longer produces sound. Pair 2 - microphone no longer picks up any sound. If I want someone to hear me while on the phone, I have to switch to pair #1 which has only one working headphone.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping they would be a top notch product to match my Samsung Galaxy s10 and Samsung Q70 TV, but, the sound was subpar and thin, even when using the software equalizer. Could only be paired with one bluetooth component at a time. Bought mainly for working out and listening to tv . They paired with my Samsung tv quickly, but I was unable to increase volume while watching tv. The call quality was so-so...So, they went back and I bought Jabra Elite 75t which are far superior to the Samsung earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Lee Walker

customer_reviews.title: From the old Galaxy buds these are a huge improvement
customer_reviews.text: First impression.. five stars.. ambient mode is insane. I've had the old Galaxy buds for about 8 months now daily use and these out of the box are blowing it away with both sound quality and ambient sound. My wife always complains about phone quality from my old buds. We will test that and I will get back to you with that opinion later. Amazing and worth the upgrade already.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lupo

customer_reviews.title: Galaxy S9 Plus
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of galaxy buds ever after trying a million different Bluetooth buds from Amazon. I have to say, these are it. The touch response is on point, battery is beautiful and the ambient sound option is an extra I never even knew I needed. You can hear everything around you while listening to music as if you had nothing on. They're small enough and barely noticeable when they're on too. The connection is perfect and they don't have the stuttering issue I've always had with other Bluetooth wireless buds. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jr. S.

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty nice! (just wish they were louder)
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use while working out and they are working quite well for me for that! I just wish they were louder. The sound is clear and nice, but not as robust as I would prefer, again, seems like maybe if they were louder, it would sound more full as well. They're very sturdy and they stay in my ears just perfectly! I don't accidentally touch the pads, but there's a setting to turn the touch pads off, if you have a problem with them. Battery life seems OK so far.
customer_reviews.author: JE1058

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Ambient Sound! Perfect for work space
customer_reviews.text: First time buyer of truly wireless Buds. Paired with a Samsung Galaxy S9+ and galaxy watch active 2. I'm most impressed with the ambient sound! Usually when I'm using headphones at work, I have to keep one earbud out in order to hear people approach me. With these, I keep ambient sound on the middle option, and can quickly mute or introduce noise with a press and hold of the TouchPad. I wouldn't recommend these for heavy gym use though, since they are sweat resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus A.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, ambient noise control and battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good sound quality, with bass and treble response good. The battery seems to last a long time I have yet to run it down to below 50% before putting them back into the case and the case charging them back to full is convenient. Comfortable in the ear during use, using default attachments, this can vary so make sure you try the different sizes. I have a galaxy S8+ phone and I did have to change the advanced bluetooth setting "Media Volume Sync" to ON in order to get good volume, with this setting off it was half of what it should have been. Once done it sounded great.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but not as comfortable as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I use these ear buds a lot, not only for music, but to take conference calls all day long for work. I really hoped that these would be more comfortable than they are, but using the medium sized covers, my ear gets sore really fast, but using the small sized covers, while feeling more comfortable, they fall out of my ear after a few minutes. I'm not sure what to do. Naturally, shortly after I purchased these, the brand new Samsung ear buds were announced. While those look even more comfortable, I'm not thrilled at the idea of shelling up more cash to replace these already.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price but lack depth
customer_reviews.text: These are my first earbuds. I think they will be fine for me since I mostly listen to podcasts and very little music. But, when it comes to music they lack deep base and the depth you would expect from a quality sound system. I have tried to adjust the sound using the "wearable" settings but base boost is just not enough and the equalizer of music apps just cannot add the desired base... If you are looking for quality sound these may not be the earbuds for you, but the best are more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: ke7aga7ek

customer_reviews.title: Much better
customer_reviews.text: I must say, the plus buds are considerably better that their predecessor. I don't really think they are that much louder, but they sound so much better. The ambience setting on these things are amazing. Today was my first full day and I kept both in all day at work and had no problems. The battery is a huge happy factor. When I got home, some 11-12 hours later, I had recharged the buds and I had 44 percent on the case. Worthy upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Breadman-walkin

customer_reviews.title: Great Features, Spotty Performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Has great features. Good battery. Cons: Have to install Galaxy Wearable app to get the most out of it, lags and pauses a lot with non Samsung devices, notably my Lenovo pc. The galaxy wearable app also auto launches every time you manually connect, very annoying. not worth the cost with the performance issues alone. Sometimes when I walk, it starts to lag as if I'm in a different room but my phone is right in my pocket less than 3 feet way from the earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Porkchop

customer_reviews.title: not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the volume loud enough while on an airplane. The ambient noise feature is poor. With ambient noise turned on I was hearing my voice amplified plus amplified noises like the air conditioning and engines which was very distracting. I did not try them while working out. In an office environment, with "ambient sound" turned off these would probably work well if you wanted to insulate yourself neighboring noise.
customer_reviews.author: A1

customer_reviews.title: Unbalanced sound and oversensitive controls.
customer_reviews.text: The left earbud has a good strong sound, but the right earbud is weak and faint. There are no instructions as to how to balance the sound. So these were basically non-function on arrival after charging them. Also, the controls are way too sensitive - if you touch them even slightly it will trigger a track change - and so adjusting them in any way while they are in your ear is basically impossible. I doubt I'll buy samsung again.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: While there are some very positive aspects to these ear buds, the one overwhelming negative is the sound quality. It really doesn't exist. I tried customizing the equalizer, and trying all of the provided sound categories, with the same results. Horrid sound quality. I can't even imagine why they would bother to put these buds on the market. On the plus side they sync flawlessly, are quite slick in regards to controls and charging case, and the finish is great. The one huge negative though, dwarfs any positive aspect of the product. The sound quality is laughable its so bad. I returned back to Amazon in under an hour.
customer_reviews.author: steve9631

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and they were great until one stopped working after 2 months, no problem it's under warranty. Well Samsung will not honor the warranty for this product if purchased from Amazon because they will not consider it a certified vendor. I wouldn't bother buying Samsung products because they don't want to honor a warranty for a product bought on amazon which is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $20? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I had the old Samsung Galaxy Buds. These new ones are a certain UPGRADE. Granted the sound quality is almost the exact same (slightly more crisp, slightly better bass, slightly better overall) but if you're looking to have much better ambient sound AND call quality, these are the perfect upgrade. Especially with a slight increase of $20. The only real complaint I have is the feel the new case has. It's more plastic-y and the hinge feels rather cheap. A nitpicky observation.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Lira

customer_reviews.title: Incremental upgrade from the original.
customer_reviews.text: Owned the original Galaxy Buds and AirPods. These are only a slight sound upgrade from the previous Galaxy Buds. They are considerably lighter and the battery life is significantly longer. The bigest difference from the original is the call quality. The caller won't be able to tell the difference in you having the phone to your ear. Compared to the AirPods they're more comfortable and sound better. You really can't compare these to AirPod Pros because they are in a different proce category.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not what they are hyped to be.
customer_reviews.text: The base quality was poor. My wired yurbuds are better. I tried every trick on the internet and even contacted Samsung directly but nothing made them satisfactory. Noise cancellation really only works with over-the-ear headphones. I returned them. I also realized that wireless earbuds are of no value when I'm in the gym where each machine has its own TV. Also no good. on an airplane when I wish to use the in seat A/V .
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Polansky MD

customer_reviews.title: ⚠️ Warnings ⚠️  Fakes!!!
customer_reviews.text: ⚠️ Warning ⚠️ I received a fake knock off version! They would not link to the Samsung wearables app and the inner speaker mess was not the same as the authentic Samsung Galaxy Bud Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Assurance?  Right Earbud DOA
customer_reviews.text: Right Earbud was dead on arrival. Received order 1 day ago. After charging for 2 hours, I paired earbuds to my phone. Right earbud was non-responsive. Checked settings on Galaxy Buds app - case battery was fully charged, left earbud displayed full charge, right earbud was completely dead. When double checking to insure buds had been paired correctly to my phone- case was paired, left ear paired, right earbud would not register. To be fair, there was not an adequate opportunity to gauge sound quality, noise cancellation or battery life. Rating heavily influenced by failure of right earbud. Extremely disappointed that this product did not receive a final QA inspection. Return in process.
customer_reviews.author: David Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Not for truck drivers
customer_reviews.text: at first sounds great but after awhile I had a hard time hearing other people talking while driving a semi truck. So yes not recommend for any truck driver. To much back ground noise for the other parties and they had a hard time hearing me. If they had noise canceling on them it might have be better ear buds. If I'm talking to someone outside or inside they a can still hear everything they say while trying to talk to the person that your on the phone with.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher m. Condon jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headphones for any Android
customer_reviews.text: They work seamlessly with my Galaxy S20 5G. The only caveat is integrating it with Galaxy Wearable, it pops up almost every time i connect to my phone and when there is an update it will pop up 100% of the time. if you can get past this then you will be rewarded with an amazing peripheral for your phone. Sure you can get Air Pods for your phone, i own Air Pods as well, but the integration 2 Samsung devices have with each other is amazing. The noise cancelling is passive not active and can get a bit annoying if you have it on and arent listening to anything, all you will hear is your own breathing.
customer_reviews.author: Murat Ersan

customer_reviews.title: It's All About The Ear Tips
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was disappointed in the sound quality and comfort of these earbuds. Considering the price, I was expecting more. However, I ran across an article that compared sound quality and comfort of various devices. Surprisingly, it all boiled down to the silicone ear tips. The ones that came with the Galaxy earbuds were not providing the quality I wanted. I experimented with tips from various earbuds I own and finally found a pair that was snug and comfortable. That definitely solved the sound quality and comfort issues with the Galaxy design of their eartips. So if you purchase these earbuds, be prepared to swap out the ear tips and you won't be disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: John McCown

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it for laptop, don't. But good for Samsung phones
customer_reviews.text: During the covid-19 quarantine, I attend lots of video or audio conference meetings from my Lenovo laptop and galaxy buds+ sometimes do not work properly. Microphone just randomly stops working and cause lots of problems for me. But with my Samsung galaxy phone, I haven't faced any earbuds issues. Biggest disadvantage is that there is no mute button or noise cancellation. It is 2020 but Samsung still launches new products as it is 2010.
customer_reviews.author: Omer Ocak

customer_reviews.title: Initial Quality Review
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! The one and only negative is the touch controls on the ear buds. The "how to" explanation is too subtle for me to grasp. I eventually turned the feature off using the App. I control the volume via the App. That said, they are comfortable. The sound is very good. The charger case works well. I use them for listening to music and for telephone calls. Given that my biggest complaint about other wireless earbud that I've owned is the poor battery life, I'll reserve comment in that regard until I've owned these for at least six months.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Ranowsky

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sound!
customer_reviews.text: Well for the price and the brand I sure thought they'd be great but nope!they sound horrible with no base and tried all ear tips and they're just garbage and it socks because I got them to use with my note 20 ultra and it didn't matter how good the phone is so if your lookin for loud sound and some base look elsewhere because thes just don't cut it,very disappointed with samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Air pods nay, buds plus yay
customer_reviews.text: Apple air pods didn't work for me. (Very uncomfortable) so i was looking at these for sometime now. Once I saw a good deal, I decided to get them and haven't regret it. I'm still learning them and everything they do. I recently learned that when I catch the bus, the left or right bud beeps when the bus is approaching depending on the direction I'm going (cool discovery) Overall, the fit the sound and functionality are great. Had them for about 90 days now, and only had to change the case twice. Haven't tried to see how long they will last full to empty yet, but don't think I will ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Jabra’s🙌🏽
customer_reviews.text: Battery Life: better than anyone 🌟 Light weight Assorted colors to choose Very nice compact design Can be used independently ( right or left ) I love how the ambient sound it’s very useful and powerful👌🏽 Doesn’t have a noise canceling but with all those pros I don’t mind Price very affordable and worth it. Highly recommended iPhone user recommends it. Very comfortable to wear all day long Until the battery dies. 11hrs+
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Does not work in Skype for business
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are amazing. They are super comfortable and just stay in the ear. Sound quality is great. Be forewarned that they do not work in skype for business calls, which was why I bought them and the reason for a 3 star review. After 15 minutes into a Skype call, the mic stops functioning and you can no longer be heard. I have posted in the Samsung community and no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not happy....
customer_reviews.text: definitely not happy with these ear buds. Left one is super choppy and has issues staying connected. $150, they should work flawlessly...
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A huge upgrade from the OG Galaxy Buds
customer_reviews.text: These sound loads better than the original Galaxy Buds, which I actually liked. The fit is the same, and is comfortable despite being inside the ear. The nubs hold them firmly within the ear; I have never once had these fall out of my ears - which is a common problem for me with earbuds, especially those that don't go inside the ear. No active noise cancellation but the sound isolation is good enough in most scenarios. The ambient mode is great and I love that you can auto-enable that for phone calls. If you own a Samsung phone, these are a must-have, and I'd honestly recommend them even to those that have Pixel, LG or other phones.
customer_reviews.author: Krell

customer_reviews.title: Ok. Not spectacular
customer_reviews.text: The ear pieces came with only one side working. Had to do a reset to get both side working again. Battery life on the earpieces are good but the charging base is have to charge base every day to ensure adequate battery for charging. Sound is not too bad. Ut could be better. Connectivity is not that great like other cheaper unit. I can only go about 10 feet from my phone, after that it starts to cut out. Overall it's not bad, howeve, considering that it's a Samsung item it's just unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, even if they're a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: Icw had two different sets of these now (the original ones and the pluses) and they work great as wireless earbuds. The connect seamlessly to my phone and have a decent range (almost across my entire small 1 story home). The battery life is good as well, and I appreciate how it now shows the percentage of the case charge when connecting your earbuds. Definitely register these with Samsung as soon as you get them though, because the letters and numbers on the bottom for the serial have a habit of wearing off and that's why I had to get new ones in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Really convienent
customer_reviews.text: These are a really nice pair of headphones. I was super hesitant to get make the jump to wireless as I was worried about charging and things but these really take the hassle out of it. The battery life on these is great and has really taken the stress of that out of the situation with the charging case and long life. Samsung has done a really good job partnering the these with their existing tech. The wireless charging on my phone is super nice. In addition these work great with my macbook. None of the unpairing and repairing hassles of swapping around devices that I am used to with bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sick in ear design.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they fit inside my ear as oppose to hanging out of your ear. It has that slick low-key design to it. People can't really tell you have them on until they get up close to you. The battery last me all day and I work 12 to 14 hours shift. There's no noise cancelation on these if that's what you're looking for. But the ambient sound on these are the best. It's almost like you're having superman hearing. I had the first Gen and then I upgraded to these ones when they first came out. So far these do not disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Geeh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact the microphone is on the outside so you can hear ambient noise if you want/need to. It's nice to be able to hear what's going on around you when you've got earbuds in and then to cancel out everything to hear a call or music if you so choose. They fit so well, and come with sizers to change to fit your ear properly, I'm actually surprised at how will they stay in your ears. All around amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Richard and Chantel McDuffie

customer_reviews.title: If you own a Samsung Galaxy device, these are the earbuds for you.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets for spouse and me to use with our two new Galaxy Tabs S6. In addition, we each have a Galaxy S9 mobile phone. The earbuds work flawlessly with either device and connecting to/switching between them is a snap. Long battery life in both the earbuds themselves and the case/battery charger. Charging the case/earbuds is easy and relatively fast since we can simply put the case on the same Samsung charging stand we use for our phones. I use mine a lot and, in a month of daily use, I have not had an instance where I've run out of charge. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Samsung Galaxy device, these are the earbuds for you
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets for spouse and me to use with our two new Galaxy Tabs S6. In addition, we each have a Galaxy S9 mobile phone. The earbuds work flawlessly with either device and connecting to/switching between them is a snap. Long battery life in both the earbuds themselves and the case/battery charger. Charging the case/earbuds is easy and relatively fast since we can simply put the case on the same Samsung charging stand we use for our phones. I use mine a lot and, in a month of daily use, I have not had an instance where I've run out of charge. I am pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I debated on spending the money on quality bt earbuds. I'm glad I bought these. I use them frequently when working out, mowing the lawn, or working on projects. The sound quality is better than I expected. The sound can be customized using the galaxy wearable app on your phone, which is nice. There is a good balance and the sound is clear. The bass is also better than I anticipated. The volume is not the loudest I've used but it's enough. It's not lacking. I have had no issues with charging, taking calls, or any function. The battery has easily lasted over 4 hours with no problems. I'm very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: must buy for Android users
customer_reviews.text: I had the original galaxy buds the yellow ones. Pretty much the same for me just glad they improve the sound for calls. I also like that the case doesn't open so easily like the previous ones and like the different ear attachments which is a plus not everyone has the same shape with their ears. I do have apple products so I do have the ipods the regular ones so it was a no brainer to get both. Ipods clearly don't work the best with Android so stick with the buds if you do. I hands down will use samsung products anyday because their products are so user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: kaykay

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfying def Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I own the previous version of the Galaxy Buds and also own the Airpods Pro. I wanted to give this a shot and so far, it is so good! When I started using the first gen Galaxy Buds, it started off wack with so many connection issues, but that wasn't the case with this. Adjusting the bass, it sounds just as good as the Airpods Pro and worth the price. I recommend this for anyone who doesn't want to spend $250 on a pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: David Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great value and incredible product. Definite improvement upon the first gen.
customer_reviews.text: Every single minor complaint I had with first gen Galaxy Buds was addressed with the Galaxy Buds+. Everything I wish the first gen had or did, these ones have it or do it. Much clearer ambient sound, like cant even tell you have headphones in. You can use ambient sound while on a call. A much better overall battery life. Clearer and better sound quality overall. Better setup with the Galaxy Gear app. Massively improved voice recognition for voice commands through headphones. I cannot say enough good things about these. The Galaxy Buds+ are without a doubt worth the extra $50 over the first gen Galaxy Buds. I recommend them 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! ❤
customer_reviews.text: First I want to tell, really really fastly shipping. I ordered 4 am and I received 9 am in same day!! I loved this colour. So It has a modern and stylish design. It does not fall from the ear. You do not feel uneasy wearing the headphones will fall while listening to music. It provides great comfort while cycling. There's heavy traffic right now and I don't hear car voices
customer_reviews.author: Cicek Sahan

customer_reviews.title: Microphone performance variable
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like, great battery life, microphone, and each bud works separately (although that not a deal breaker for me). I compared it with the Jabra elite 65t and AirPods 2 and the microphone was better when recording in a noisy environment, however during calls people complained that they couldn’t here me. I suspect that the internal microphone performance is affected by the quality of the seal, whereas the AirPods 2 are worse in noisy environment but their quality is consistent. I ended up returning the galaxy buds+
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: These things have adequate sound for listening to podcasts and music. The equalizer is pretty much non-existent. None of the settings make much difference. The received sound during telephone calls is marginal, the transmitted sound is an unintelligible staticky mess. No one can understand anything I say. If I wasn’t passed the return date, I’d send them back. Fail on the telephone use, adequate on the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Alfa_Romeo_fan

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a fantastic set of earbuds, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent battery life, lasts all day at work and then some. Sound quality is great, but not mind blowing. Bass could be a little better. Doesn't have Active Noise Canceling, but you don't need it since these seal in your ears. Ambient sound is a life saver at work when you need to hear what's going on around you. I really like the touch controls, very customizable, and the volume up and down controls are a nice upgrade from the original Galaxy Buds. Call quality is crystal clear, even when I'm 10 or 15 feet away from my phone. Buy them, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lippert

customer_reviews.title: Better than gen 1? Not in sound.
customer_reviews.text: These things don't sound very good to me, in fact they sound just as bad as the gen 1 version which my wife has. When I compare them to the standard corded AKG buds that came with my Galaxy S9 there's absolutely no comparison. The corded phones have more clear bass, smoother presence, less fatiguing highs. You know, like real headphones. The upgraded sound was the main selling point and why I decided to spend the extra money on these but I'm disappointed. I'm sticking with my corded phones for music listening while these are just for meetings and phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: T. N. Baier

customer_reviews.title: impressive sound; secure; not so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: + i did not expect such a good sound from this tiny things (only normal preset is fine; others sound like sh!t) + battery life is really impressive!!! + they are pretty securely hold in ears, almost like screws (and one has to screw them into ears) - software is more spyware and bloatware, asks for every single piece of your phone to be exposed to it - ux: i absolutely don't like beating my ears to control music/volume/whateverelse ? comfort: my ears get tired, not really seamless; don't fall out when chewing, but sound distorts... naturally...
customer_reviews.author: abetaev

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and clear
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews regarding the intensity of its bass lacking. It can be improved and enhanced by finagling with your phone's audio settings and with Buds+. The clarity of these is simply awesome. Since my left ear is very different than my right in size and shape, I accommodated each bud securely by using the extra and different sized bud accessories included. Maybe in the near future I'll try a close but inexpensive facsimile -- out of curiosity -- but for now I am very happy with the crisp, clear and strong sound of these.
customer_reviews.author: A. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between buying these or AirPod Pros. In a side-by-side comparison between the two, the sound quality is very on par with one another. I love using the Dynamic and Bass Boost settings on these. I also enjoy the touch pad. The battery life is excellent. The audio is also great with calls. I love the variety of ambient settings, but my ONLY complaint is that if you’re outside, ambient is very sensitive to any wind, and it’s really annoying. Overall, I would recommend these, especially since they’re less costly than the Pros.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not let down
customer_reviews.text: First day with these and I wore them 10 straight hours. No soreness, no discomfort, single full charge. Only a 4 on sound quality and noise cancel because...1 day. Looking forward to more "testing". AND...they came a day early! They come with 3 size fittings. Buy them and see for yourself. Edit: the only true issue that I have is that replacement fit covers aren't offered as an add on or suggested item. Don't lose or damage them.
customer_reviews.author: 8uckeyenut

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I only have a couple pairs of true wireless headphones so I don't have much to compare it to, but man oh man these headphones absulotely rock! Plenty of ear tips and wing tips to get a good seal and block out ~80% of the noise around you(there is no active noise cancellation, not a deal breaker for me) and you could always bump up the volume and you barely hear anything around you. Very nice lightweight buds that don't look ridiculous, if you're using a Samsung device like I am the connectivity is flawless, I just turn on Bluetooth on the phone and open up the case and they're already paired in about 5 seconds. Highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Kalani

customer_reviews.title: If you loved the Galaxy Buds you will love these too.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these yesterday. Absolutely love the color! I selected, cloud blue, reminds me of a Cinderella blue. Although if I am being honest, the sound quality is almost identical to the Galaxy buds but the real reason I purchased these, were because of the extended battery life. They exceeded my expectation in that field. They truly do last 20 hrs. The ambient sound option is also improved when compared to the Galaxy buds. Overall it is an upgrade from the previous model. And with that being said, both are a good option to purchase. Its all up to whether you have a bit more to splurge.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Not all Galaxy Buds+ are made equal.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair NEW and they only lasted 5-6 hours at under half volume with ambient on high on full charge. returned those and got replacements. Replacements i battery drained them twice at full volume with ambient on high, streaming music/live streams/netflix and they are currently lasting 8-9 hours on a single charge! If your buds+ are under performing brand new, return them they might be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Freeplay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but they wont stay in my ears.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life, audio quality and compatibility with my note 9 is wonderful. They connect super fast, the ambient sound feature works great. My problem lies with these things constantly loosening and falling from my ears. I have tried all 3 sets of tips and wings, all giving me the same problem. Very dissatisfied that I cant use these without constantly making sure they stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Love these things.
customer_reviews.text: I came from airpods and did not like the in war feel of these at first. They did grow on me and the sound pass through is fantastic.ibuse these at work every day and because they are in war they block a lot of noise which is great. I can enable pass through when needed by a long touch and talk to my coworkers. The touch controls are really good too giving you a lot more control over these than airpods. Battery life is a big sell here for me. They can last a 10 hour work day when my airpods were dead before lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Graff

customer_reviews.title: So happy I gave it a second chance.
customer_reviews.text: First pair i bought were defective but i was able to return them for a refund. No issue. Bought another pair and they work beautifully. Great sound quality and i love all the features it has to interact with my Note 10+ Was worried they wouldn't fit in my ears since I've always stayed away from buds because they usually just fall out of my ear. But these fit perfectly. I can dance, workout, ride my nit, etc. With these and they dont budge. I love my buds+.
customer_reviews.author: brenda flippen

customer_reviews.title: Love these earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones I'm really impressed I switched from airpods pro. Comparing them biggest things I noticed was buds had more bass without a doubt but airpods pro got louder. However the volume was my only complaint especially without noise cancelation...however I did find an app for Android called "volume booster" that makes these painfully loud (200% boost). Personally I think they are more comfortable than airpods and feel more secure. Just to summarize since I got these and the volume booster I haven't picked up my airpods 1 time
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a loud area, and these really drowned out the noise so I can hear the music loud and clear. Plus the battery life is insane. Used them for a little over 9hrs and they still had juice! Lastly, they stay in place. I put them on and violently shook my head. They stay like magic! Also the Galaxy Wearables app makes them even better!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE A MAJOR GO!
customer_reviews.text: Using Flossy Carter's ranking system on a scale of 1-10 these are a triple major go. The battery on these is no joke with 11 hours on the buds alone and 22 hours with the case. Also, call quality on these are great with everything sounding clear you should have no problems taking a call with these and with ambient sound you could listen to music and still here what's going on around you which is great. Now, this could vary from person to person but for me these are comfortable which is perfect for long listening sessions but your mileage may vary. All in all these are great buds for the price and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Memo

product_meta.title: Samsung Galaxy Buds+ Plus, True Wireless Earbuds (Wireless Charging Case included), White – US Version
product_meta.description: Style:Galaxy Buds+| Color:Cloud BlueSamsung Galaxy Buds+ are versatile earbuds that harmonize warm, satisfying bass tones with crisp high notes delivering addictively rich tracks. With the ability to selectively tune in or out environmental noise, you can stay in the zone on a phone call or get lost in your favorite playlist, all without hitting pause. With a battery that is built to go all day and a customizable fit, Galaxy Buds+ are designed to move to your rhythm.
feature_bullets: Exactly what you want to hear. Galaxy Buds+ are the perfect fitting earbuds to isolate you from distracting noises, so you can stay focused on what you want. And if you’d like to filter in some of the outside world to be more in-tune with your surroundings, you can switch on Ambient Aware2. Hear flight announcements, oncoming traffic or your order number while still enjoying your favorite playlist or podcast.

22 hours of serious sound. Get up to 11 hours of nonstop music on a single charge, then pop your Galaxy Buds+ in the wireless charging case and get nearly 11 more. Forgot to charge them the night before? No worries. ?3 minutes of charging gives you one hour of play time, so you have enough juice for your commute or workout.

Your voice, loud and clear. Ensure you’re heard clearly. A dedicated internal and two external microphones pick up your voice and isolate it from outside noises. When you’re on a call, your voice comes through richly and confidently, even in noisy locations.
Android & iOS compatible. Pair with smart devices via Bluetooth. 5 Use the Galaxy Wearable app on Android and Galaxy Buds+ app on iOS to make the most of your earphones.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,462 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
